base_method: n/a (power company interrupts operators service itself, the operator does not choose how much to reduce load by)
pay_function: Demand charge is eliminated  as customers are willing to have their load interrupted at any time
elig: Must have peak loads of at least 100kW and no larger than 10 MW

base_method: n/a
pay_function: Capacity Payment of $32 per kW and energy payment of $0.09 per kWh
elig: n/a

base_method: n/a
pay_function: Capacity Payment of $40 per kW and energy payment of $0.09 per kWh
elig: n/a

base_method: n/a
pay_function: Customers receive a monthly billing credit. This is calculated by multiplying the Market Value Capacity Price (MVCP) for the 5 summer months x the customer's nominated interruptible load.
elig: Must have a load of at least 3000 kW and be willing to shed at least 1000 kW

base_method: Average hourly load from 10 pervious weekdays/ non-holidays during which a DR event occurred
pay_function: n/a
elig: n/a

base_method: Use at average monthly demand during on-peak hours (excluding during DR events) for summer. Average monthly demand during assessment hours for winter. Average partial-peak hours (excluding DR events) for partial-peak hours
pay_function: Monthly payment with a payment structure that depends on the season, the range of load reduction (kW), and the notification time. Summer season has higher incentives and shorter notification time also has higher incentives. The penalty for failing to reduce load is an increase in excess energy charge.
elig: Must have at least 100kW peak demand (during summer peak or winter partial-peak). Also must be enrolled in a PG&E non-residential electric demand time-of-use program.

base_method: Use at average monthly demand during on-peak hours (excluding during DR events) for summer. Average monthly demand during assessment hours for winter. Average partial-peak hours (excluding DR events) for partial-peak hours
pay_function: Monthly payment with a payment structure that depends on the season, the range of load reduction (kW), and the notification time. Summer season has higher incentives and shorter notification time also has higher incentives. The penalty for failing to reduce load is an increase in excess energy charge.
elig: Must have at least 100kW peak demand (during summer peak or winter partial-peak). Also must be enrolled in a PG&E non-residential electric demand time-of-use program.

base_method: Average hourly power usage for 10 previous weekdays
pay_function: Fixed rate of $2 per kWh reduced for non-residential customers. (no penalty)
elig: All customers eligible

base_method: Average hourly power usage for 10 previous weekdays
pay_function: Fixed rate of $2 per kWh reduced for non-residential customers. (no penalty)
elig: All customers eligible

base_method: Average energy usage 10 days prior to event day or "day-of-adjustment" of baseline based on that morning's energy usage
pay_function: No payment incentive, but penalty is as follows: penalty is $6.00 per KWH times the average total load on the applicable circuit less than the required maximum load level, which is measured during each half-hour of the rotating outage
elig: Must be able to reduce load by 15% of baseline

base_method: Average hourly power usage for 10 previous weekdays or day-of adjustment
pay_function: $0.10 per kWh billing credit
elig: Must have at least 100kW monthly average demand and willing to reduce load by 15%

program: PowerDirect® Automated Demand Response Program (day of) (California)
base_method: Average hourly load from 10 pervious weekdays/ non-holidays during which a DR event occurred
pay_function: $175 per kW measured by the average of the two consecutive hours with the highest reduction of load during an event. If the second hour is less than 50% of the first hour, use a four hour average.
elig: Demand should be at least 300kW and be willing to reduce by 50kW and 5% of peak demand

program: PowerDirect® Automated Demand Response Program (day ahead) (California)
base_method: Average hourly load from 10 pervious weekdays/ non-holidays during which a DR event occurred
pay_function: $175 per kW measured by the average of the two consecutive hours with the highest reduction of load during an event. If the second hour is less than 50% of the first hour, use a four hour average.
elig: Demand should be at least 300kW and be willing to reduce by 50kW and 5% of peak demand

base_method: Average of the three highest energy usage days over the past 10 weekdays
pay_function: Event incentive is the same for both day ahead and day of program and determined by monthly performance and made based on 6 events per season each 4 hours in duration. For day of program, $12/kw payment made monthly. Customers also receive $0.25 per kWh curtailed.
elig: Must be able to reduce load by at least 100kW

base_method: Average of the three highest energy usage days over the past 10 weekdays
pay_function: Event incentive is the same for both day ahead and day of program and determined by monthly performance and made based on 6 events per season each 4 hours in duration. For day ahead program, $8/kw payment made monthly. Customers also receive $0.25 per kWh curtailed.
elig: Must be able to reduce load by at least 100kW

base_method: Median maximum hourly demands daily from noon to 8pm on weekdays of June 1st through September 30th the previous year
pay_function: Billing credit rate differs between season, constrained vs. unconstrained, and secondary vs. primary vs. transimssion (not sure what that means)
elig: Must have at least 300 kW of interruptible demand

base_method: Average of the measured demand during 15 minutes of the last 5 highest energy consumption days within the last 10 non-holiday, non-weekend, non-event days.
pay_function: Reservation incentive calculated by multiplying monthly load reduction obligation by reservation incentive kilowatt rate. Also performance incentivethat can be received if the customer exceeds their load reduction obligation. Both are billing credits.
elig: Must have at least 25 kW of interruptible demand each month between June and September

base_method: Average of the measured demand during 15 minutes of the last 5 highest energy consumption days within the last 10 non-holiday, non-weekend, non-event days.
pay_function: Performance incentive billing credit based on each hour of load reduction
elig: Must be able to reduce demand by at least 500 kW

base_method: Average usage  over 10 days within 5 minute intervals
pay_function: $5.00 per kW based on nominated load and $0.50 per kW load reduced. Both are billing credits. Nominated load shifted for poor performance, which could lead to a loss in incentive money.
elig: Must have demand of at least 200 kW and reduce at least 50 kW of load

base_method: Average usage  over 10 days within 5 minute intervals
pay_function: $10.00 per kW based on nominated load and $0.50 per kW load reduced. Both are billing credits. Nominated load shifted for poor performance, which could lead to a loss in incentive money.
elig: Must have demand of at least 200 kW and reduce at least 50 kW of load

base_method: n/a
pay_function: Average season performance percentage is calculated by dividing average load reduction by the average event week nomination. Fixed capacity payment rate depends on the range of average season performance percentage that the customer falls within (this number is multiplied by the number of weeks in the season). After the first 4 events of the season, a variable payment of $0.20 kWh is possible to receive.
elig: Must be able to reduce at least 20 kW during an event and have at least 3 events per season

base_method: n/a
pay_function: n/a
elig: Must have a load of at least 1000 kW

pay_function: Penalty for not curtailing is $10 per kW in excess of predetermined demand level. Discount is applied to controllable demand (higher discount for summer)

base_method: n/a

Energy payment of $0.20 per kWh reduced for the first 4 hours of an event If there have been less than 50 hours dispatched for the year. Proportional penalty if load reduction falls below 50% of the customer's nomination.
elig: Must be able to reduce at least 50 kW of load

base_method: n/a
pay_function: Reinbursment price for load curtailment will be agreed upon between the customer and the company. Penalty for non-performance will be ~$10.00 per kW of non-performance.
elig: Must have a demand of at least 500kW

base_method: n/a
pay_function: Billing credit of $10.25 kW/day. Penalty for failing to reduce by 100kW is forfeiting credits
elig: Must be able to reduce load by at least 100kW

base_method: n/a
pay_function: Billing credit of $5.12 kW/day. Penalty for failing to reduce by 100kW is forfeiting credits
elig: Must be able to reduce load by at least 100kW

base_method: n/a
pay_function: Capacity credit of $3.10 /kW of leased capacity and energy credit of $0.16 /kWh  (monthly billing credits). Credits can be suspended for failure to make leased capacity available.
elig: Must be able to reduce load by at least 100kW

base_method: Average load for the hours during which OPPD's load was within 90% of OPPD's annual peak (recent historical load)
pay_function: Billing credit based on how much energy is curtailed along with the max capacity curtailment of 100 kW
elig: Must be able to reduce load by at least 500kW

base_method: Average load for the hours during which OPPD's load was within 90% of OPPD's annual peak (recent historical load)
pay_function: Billing credit based on how much energy is curtailed along with the max capacity curtailment of 100 kW
elig: Must be able to reduce load by at least 10,000kW

base_method: n/a
pay_function: The credit rate ($/kW) will be offered by the company. It will be credited to the customer based on the percent of the committed load that is reduced. If the customer reduces less than 90% of the committed load, the credit will be the actual load reduction x the offered load reduction price plus the difference between 90% of the committed load reduction and the actual reduced load x 200% of the offer price. If the customer reduces between 90% and 110% of the committed load reduction, they will be credited based on their actual reduced load x the offer price. If the customer reduces above 110% of their committed load, they will be credited 110% of their committed load x the offered price. Penalty is removal from the rate schedule.
elig: Must be able to reduce load by at least 50 kW

base_method: Determined by service agreement
pay_function: 50% off of the excess demand charges during the 1st 12 months in the program. (come back to this)
elig: Must have a non-firm contract demand of at least 10 MW and a firm contract demand of at least 25% of non-firm contract demand

comp: Public Service Company of New Mexico
base_method: "One-minute interval load data is used to calculate load impacts using a customer baseline (“CBL”) method"""
pay_function: Annual incentive paytment based on how much electricity demand is curtailed. (not much detail)
elig: Must have a peak demand greater than 50 kW and on specific rates

program: Interruptible Credit Option (1-hour notice, 40hrs, year round) (New Mexico)
base_method: Median of max 30 minute integrated  demands  between the hours of 12:00 pm and 8:00 pm weekdays between June 1 and September 30 of the prior year
pay_function: Monthly billing credits calculated by monthly credit rate (mcr) x lesser of customer's CIL or the interruptible demand. MCR equations are different for winter and summer:  Summer (June 1 - September 30) Monthly Credit, per kW - month: MCR = [$7.75 x Ca x Nf) +(Av x Ha)] x Slfx 130% Winter (October 1 - May 30) Monthly Credit  per kW - month: MCR = [$7.75 x Ca x Nf) +(Av x Ha)] x Slf x 85%  (each variable is defined and outlined in the link i provided)"
elig: Must have a load of at least 300 kW during summer

program: Voluntary Load Reduction Purchase Option (New Mexico)
base_method: 5 day average of  weekday integrated loads for the period ending the day before an event
pay_function: Payment or billing credit will be given to the customer. Determined by applying the agreed upon selling price to the purchase quantity. (Purchase quantity depends on the difference between the company's actual load and its CLR).
elig: Must have a load of at least 500 kW in the summer

base_method: n/a
pay_function: Penalty for not curtailing is $8 per kW in excess of predetermined demand level. Discount is applied to controllable demand (higher discount for summer).

elig: Must be able to reduce load by at least 50 kW

Energy payment of $0.20 per kWh reduced for the first 4 hours of an event If there have been less than 50 hours dispatched for the year. Proportional penalty if load reduction falls below 50% of the customer's nomination.

Fixed capacity payment rate depends on the range of average season performance percentage that the customer falls within (this number is multiplied by the number of weeks in the season). base_method: n/a
pay_function: Penalty for not curtailing is $10 per kW in excess of predetermined demand level. Discount is applied to controllable demand (higher discount for summer)
elig: Must be able to reduce load by at least 50 kW

base_method: Rather than a baseline calculation, performance is determined by if the pump is fully shut off during an event.
pay_function: Payment is determined by multiplying avg load a customer can shut off by the incentive rate (this is set based on the customer's expected average kW per pump). 20% bonus for if an event lasts until 9pm
elig: Must be on schedule 10 with Rocky Mountain Power

base_method: Average consumption (per hour) for the corresponding hour of the previous two weeks
pay_function: Billing credits calculated by the formula: 0.5 x ((Offer price x loss factor) - base schedule energy charge) x curtailed energy. Customers pay a penalty for failing to curtail their nominated amount (they don't have to pay if it is their first curtailment period).
elig: Must be able to curtail at least 500kW over the course of one hour

base_method: n/a
pay_function: Payments of $200 per kW reduced each season
elig: Business of all sizes welcome

base_method: n/a
pay_function: Payments of $35 per average kW reduced each season and a bonus of $10 per kW across weekend events
elig: Business of all sizes welcome

base_method: Average of the three days with the highest energy usage during the past 30 days (not including the day before a peak savings day or weekends or holidays)
pay_function: Billing credit of $1.25 per kW reduced below baseline
elig: No enrollment needed, usually small companies

base_method: n/a
pay_function: Payment for load reduction (based on the 2023-2024 year) range from $15,000 - $20,000 per MW. Participants can also receive energy payments, and there are "substantial" penalties for not reducing load.
elig: Must reside in PJM jusrisdiction

base_method: Looks at the customer's previous 10 similar days (no holidays or event days)
pay_function: Payment of $35 per kW for weekdays and an added $10 per kW on weekends. Also $1500 flat incentive to pay for required metering.
elig: Must pay into energy efficiency fund and must be a customer of Unitil, National Grid, or Eversource

base_method: Looks at the customer's previous 10 similar days (no holidays or event days)
pay_function: Payment of $200 per kW. Also $1500 flat incentive to pay for required metering.
elig: Must pay into energy efficiency fund and must be a customer of Unitil, National Grid, or Eversource

program: Connected Solutions Targeted Summer Dispatch (New Hampshire)
base_method: Looks at the customer's previous 10 similar days (no holidays or event days)
pay_function: Payment of $35 per kW reduced.
elig: Must pay into energy efficiency fund and must be a customer of Unitil, National Grid, or Eversource

base_method: Uses "Customer Baseline Load Procedure"
pay_function: Payment of $3 per kW per month for customers in tier 1 locations. $5 per kW per month for customers in tier 2 locations. Also receive energy perfromance payments of $0.50 per kWh reduced.
elig: Must adhere to the rules

base_method: Average of the hourly usage of the top five days within the past 10 eligible days.
pay_function: Tier 1 customers can make $18 per kW monthly and Tier 2 customers can make $25 per kW monthly. Also eligible for energy payment of $1 per kWh.
elig: Must be able to curtail at least 50kW of load.

base_method: Must reduce demand to a demand firm level agreed upon with the company

pay_function: "Energy buy back price quotes" will be provided by the company and will be payment for reducing load below baseline. (Customer will provide estimated load reduction value).
elig: Must have billing period max 15-min demand of less than 500kW

program: Large Load Curtailable Rider Summer (On Peak) (South Carolina)
base_method: Reducing the load to a firm demand level during events
pay_function: Credits of $4.90 per kW of demonstrated curtailable demand and " Variable Environmental & PURPA Capacity & DERP Avoided Capacity credit" of $1.70 per kW curtailable demand. Penalty for using premium demand during a level 1 curtailment event is $2.40 per kWh and for a level 2 curtailment event is $40.00 per kW
elig: Must be able to curtail at least 1000 kW of load

program: Peak Shaving and Emergency Demand Response Rider (summer) (Tennessee)
base_method: Baseline calculated from hourly demands from the highest 4 of the 5 most recent similar weekdays
pay_function: Curtailment energy credit of 90% of AEP East Load Zone hourly Real-Time LMP per curtailment hour. Curtailment demand credit of either the 4 year average PJM RPM Limited Base DR Base Residual Auction Clearing price (calculated with the previous, current, and next 2 delivery years) or 70% of RPM Net CONE for the current delivery year (both in $ per kW-month). Whichever is higher. Also monthly demand and event credits. Penalty for non-compliance is an annual non-compliance charge of avergae non-compliance demand x 110% of the curtailment demand credits x 12.
elig: Must be able to curtail 250kW.

program: Peak Shaving and Emergency Demand Response Rider (non summer) (Tennessee)
base_method: Baseline calculated from hourly demands from the highest 4 of the 5 most recent similar weekdays
pay_function: Curtailment energy credit of 90% of AEP East Load Zone hourly Real-Time LMP per curtailment hour. Curtailment demand credit of either the 4 year average PJM RPM Limited Base DR Base Residual Auction Clearing price (calculated with the previous, current, and next 2 delivery years) or 70% of RPM Net CONE for the current delivery year (both in $ per kW-month). Whichever is higher. Also monthly demand and event credits. Penalty for non-compliance is an annual non-compliance charge of avergae non-compliance demand x 110% of the curtailment demand credits x 12.
elig: Must be able to curtail 250kW.

program: Commercial and Industrial Interruptible Rider Emergency Summer(Wisconsin)
base_method: Reduce load to firm nomination level
pay_function: Billing credit of $8.039 per kW of max interruptible demand. Penalty for non-compliance is highest demand during non-complicance x annual credits x 110% or additianal power costs to company (whichever is higher)
elig: Must have a minimum of 200kW interruptible demand

program: Commercial and Industrial Interruptible Rider Emergency Winter (Wisconsin)
base_method: Reduce load to firm nomination level
pay_function: Billing credit of $4.020 per kW of max interruptible demand. Penalty for non-compliance is highest demand during non-complicance x annual credits x 110% or additianal power costs to company (whichever is higher)
elig: Must have a minimum of 200kW interruptible demand
